Name: Dream of A Rusted Sword: Part II
Description: In a valley scarred by the Dark Tide, an old Gladiator silently awaits his destiny. Like an ancient, rusted sword, he dreams of past glories.
QuestDesc: In a valley scarred by the Dark Tide, an old Gladiator silently awaits his destiny. Like an ancient, rusted sword, he dreams of past glories.

Conditions.PreQuestName: Dream of A Rusted Sword: Part I

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Champion! Thanks for convincing Aeolus to quit. It's time we headed out too.

Options.PlotLineKey: His captain felt sorry about his resignation.
Why don't you return to the Gladiators?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta wouldn't let a warrior like you go to waste.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know she wouldn't. I was her 98th opponent, and I could feel her spirit through her blade. She's done a lot to make this city better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But ever since I set foot back on this land... I've been dreaming. Dreaming of the past. Of Cato. Of the hunts shared with my old friends who fell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I dream of them laughing, charging toward the Dark Tide—and then vanishing. I was the one left behind. The one to bury them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One bloody grave, then another. And another.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that I've woken from those dreams... I just don't believe in myself anymore. And I can't buy into that so-called "Gladiator's glory" either.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for Aeolus... even if he died out here, no one would know. No one pays attention to an old man's last moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, did you know he was Augusta's seventh opponent? She beat him in just two strikes. And I used to take him down using only my left hand! Haha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's at his temporary camp, packing up his things. I'll send you the coordinates.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Traces of a massive Dark Tide creation?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These aren't Kerasaur footprints. Could it be… the Corrosaurus?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are human tracks here too. Was it Aeolus? Did he clash with the Corrosaurus… and lead it away?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I should hurry up.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aeolus trapped the Corrosaurus inside the cave. What is he planning?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to find a way in.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These facilities…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Has he been training here all this time?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So close to the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All this dynamite...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is he planning to blow up the entire cave?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... Ugh, I'm fine!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aim for the ankle on its right leg! That's its weak spot!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aeolus leans weakly against the stone. Only a faint flicker of life remains in his eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This scene is all too familiar. Heartbreakingly so. A "gift" from fate, carefully prepared for those who dare to defy it.

Options.PlotLineKey: Listen and honor its weight in silence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've always been… a coward…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feared Augusta, so I lost my will to fight her the moment we crossed blades…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feared the Lion Beast, so I ran back to camp...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feared death, so I turned away. Left Master Cato behind to face that hopeless end alone…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… I keep having the same dream… In that dream, I still lose to Augusta... I never earn Cato's approval. But…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I also dream… of standing right in the swarm of the Dark Tide's creatures. Master Cato is behind me, and I'm holding my ground, fighting with all my might…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would Master Cato smile... and say he misjudged me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh… just a dream... but this… this isn't so bad either…

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To take the Corrosaurus down with me… Ha, who said I didn't have a sense of humor…

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What kind of joke is this, huh? A prank? If I fall for it, is he gonna jump out and mock me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aeolus, you old fool... You think I'd find this funny?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Damn you Gladiators... Damn the Dark Tide... Damn it all!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I'll tell Rolla later. Just—just give me a moment. I'll see you around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aeolus... he was truly a great Gladiator. I will make sure his story lives on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand your sorrow for Aeolus. But Septimont doesn't measure one's sacrifice by whether it was "necessary."

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you can't understand Aeolus's choice, then think of it this way:

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was a Gladiator. That's all there is to it.
